column4: i'm sorry.  i have to do something against the rules and offtopic just to celebrate ubuntu with you.  i'm poping my dual core 3.2 preston in my linux box tomorrow and putting my Celeron D 2.8 in my windows box.
i know that buy synaptic package manager wont accept my sudo password
there is no "sudo password".  Again, it is your *user's* password.
thanks for clearing that up.  now, any idea on how to get synapic to accept my *user* password ?
are you able to run any commands with sudo?
I asked you if you could run any commands with sudo...
yes i sure can from command line
then there should be no reason you can't run synaptic

well, synaptic isn't accepting my users password (which is the same i use to execute a sudo) i've typed it over and over to make sure i got it right.  there has to be a file that saves the password for that, thats different from my user password
i will attempt to type my password correctly, one more time.
wrong.  its definitely rejecting the *correct* password :/  i'll ask around later maybe someone else will know.  i can adminster my system from the command line thats alright by me
no, not wrong.  There is *no* file that stores a separate password for synaptic.
ok.  understood.  well, irregardless of that fact, when my system wishes to update through a gui, i can't do anything about it
sorry to hear that.  That's puzzling.
